RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TWO BRONZE STARS took an immediate lead and moved to the inside to rate the pace, was urged away leaving the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the turn then vigorously hand ridden through the lane. CATCH THE HUMOR gave chase through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn then dueled through the stretch to take a late nod for second. BRADLEY DO RIGHT chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. GOOD BUZZ gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path and flattened stride later yards. RACING HOT LINE chased the early pace two deep while between horses but weakened in the three path on the turn. VALHALLA'S PALACE bobbled at the break, gave chase and raced in the five path on the turn and showed little in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Valhalla's Palace
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Two Bronze Stars
ENTRY.COMMENT: immediate lead,rated pace inside,urged away turn,hand ridden lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 16600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,25 0 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ARROWWOOD saved ground on the first turn then eased out into the backstretch, started a bid approaching the quarter pole and steadily progressed in the three path on the far turn, took the nod toward mid-stretch and dueled clear later yards. LADRO DI FICHI stalked from the three path then challenged leaving the three eighths pole, raced close two deep on the far turn and took a brief slim lead entering the stretch, but was caught toward mid-stretch and relented later yards. RIDE THE RAPIDS became a bit anxious in the gate then took the lead and moved to the inside to show the way, came under pressure approaching the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail, gave up the lead leaving the turn then flattened toward mid-stretch. TIZBIT stalked two deep, challenged leaving the three eighths pole but dropped back at the rail toward the quarter and weakened. CONSTITUTIONALRAGE saved ground on the first turn, gave chase into the backstretch, raced in the four path on the far turn and showed little in the lane. MISSAWLET settled in the three path the first turn, left the turn outside and gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but flattened stride in the three path on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Constitutionalrage
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 1/2,4p far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Ride the Rapids
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Eastham Richard

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MARSHALL PEANUT took the lead on the chute and rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths pole, rounded the turn at the rail and was kept alert through the stretch. SHOOT THE BREEZE gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and had to settle for second best. SEABROOK ISLAND gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail, eased to the outside leaving the turn and came along for third later yards. RIDE THE BRAND chased, raced at the rail on the turn then flattened in the lane. ROBBIELIKESHIM bobbled and was bumped leaving the gate then gave chase, raced three wide on the turn and showed little further. ESTRELLA FUGAZ ducked in, hit the gate on exit and made contact with Robbielikeshim, gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and weakened. DANTE'S INFERNO gave chase outside and rounded the turn about the four path.

ENTRY.NAME: Marshall Peanut
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 5/16,rail turn,kept alert lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 17600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BOUNDTOBEOK stalked from the three path then challenged leaving the half mile pole, dueled for the lead two deep at the quarter, drew clear midway on the far turn and held well under steady handling. TRAVEL SMART rated a short lead inside, came under pressure to keep Boundtobeok at bay leaving the half mile pole, succumbed to that one at the quarter, dropped back midway on the far turn and relented the final sixteenth. HERETODAYGONMANANA raced off the rail on the opening turn, started a bid approaching the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and came along to take third mid-stretch. WINDSOR'S PLAY tapered in and stalked the early pace two deep, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened in the lane. BREADMAN'S ROSEBUD rounded the first turn in the three path, left the turn outside and picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the five path on the far turn and passed a rival. SUPERSNAKE rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened in the three path on the far turn.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ESPRESSO stalked in the four path the first turn, moved to even terms toward the half mile pole and dueled from that point, took the lead two deep approaching the quarter pole, raced clear midway on the far turn and was kept sharp in the stretch. GREATANDGOOD rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced close three wide on the far turn, cleared second past the eighth pole and finished evenly. ALDARIGHTTRICKS saved ground on the first turn, gave chase past the half mile pole and raced near the rail on the far turn, angled to the four path leaving the turn and came along for third mid-stretch. MY BALBOA rated a short early lead inside, was met at even terms nearing the half mile pole and dueled from that point, ceded the advantage approaching the quarter, dropped back at the rail midway on the far turn and weakened. JUST MURPHY saved ground on the opening turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. JUST CALL ME AL raced well off the pace about the three path and showed little response through the backstretch. THEIRREGISTRDIMNOT stalked the early pace from the two and three paths but faded past the seven sixteenths pole. PREPPYFIED showed little response. JUBA'S MOCHA rounded the first turn about the five path and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Espresso
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4p,even terms 1/2,dueled,clear mid turn,kept sharp lane

ENTRY.NAME: Greatandgood
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 7/16,3wd far turn,even finish

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 3 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 3 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or L ess Not Considered In Weight Allowances) NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TATOR MADE pressured the pace inside through most of the backstretch but steadied at the rail approaching the quarter pole, moved to the three path on the turn, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and held on well. ASUE ducked out leaving the gate then chased outside, rounded the turn about the five path and dug in to take second later yards. KILBRITTAIN'S RED engaged in close chase through the backstretch, took the lead two deep midway on the turn, was steadily handled leaving the turn but gave up the lead while flattening stride mid-stretch. ONLY KIDDING gave chase, rounded the turn at the rail and ran evenly in the lane. CAROLINA SUN chased through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. CALERA LOVE set a pressured pace from the half mile pole, but was met at the rail midway on the turn and weakened in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Calera Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,met rail mid turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Carolina Sun
ENTRY.OWNER: Bone Robert D and Brown Jr Edward J

ENTRY.NAME: Asue
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out break,chased,5p turn,up 2nd later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. No n-winners Of A Race Since October 3 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 3 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STORM BOARDER (CHI) took the lead passing the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn and just lasted. GOLDEN G chased outside, raced in the five path on the turn, had a strong finish outside and just missed. INSIDE RISK gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path and finished well to take third the final yards. SHIP THE GOODS gave chase, rounded the turn in the three path and ran evenly in the lane. MR TINGLES came away awkwardly then pressured the pace leaving the half mile pole, raced at a close disadvantage off the rail on the turn then flattened stride nearing mid-stretch. BRISTOL CHANNEL gave chase through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly to mid-stretch, but steadied lacking a clear path later yards.

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Tingles
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break,pressed pace,close off rail turn,flattened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Golden G
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside,5p turn,strong finish outside,just missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 3, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since May 3 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BIG HAMBONE gave close chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail, dug in leaving the eighth pole and got up the final strides. STEVETHEVANDRIVER took the lead nearing the half mile pole and rated the pace, was pressured at the rail on the turn, dug in under steady stretch handling but was caught in the final strides. MONTAUK DADDY chased through the backstretch, raced in the six path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. PRINCE OF FENTON chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. PROTA chased through the backstretch, raced close in the four path on the turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. SO COURAGEOUS gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and showed little in the lane. BIG DADDY D R gave chase and rounded the turn about the six path. HEY CONGRATS stumbled leaving the gate then gave chase outside and rounded the turn in the seven path.

ENTRY.NAME: Stevethevandriver
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,pressured rail turn,caught final strides

ENTRY.NAME: So Courageous
ENTRY.OWNER: Diamond Oak Stable and Splurgin Racing

ENTRY.NAME: Prota
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Big Hambone
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,dug in lane,up final strides
